Function Documentation

void sg_cursor_clear_hline ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor,
sg_size_t  width 
)

Clears a horizontal line at the cursor's location and increments the cursor's position to the pixel after the end of the line.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor
widthThe width of the line

This function operates on the bmap using 32-bit words so it is faster than simply drawing pixels using a loop.

This operation assigns a value of 0 to the pixels.

void sg_cursor_dec_x ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor)

Decrements a cursor's x location.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor

This function doesn't account for the size of the bmap.

See also
sg_cursor_inc_x()
void sg_cursor_dec_y ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor)

Decrements a cursor's y location.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor

This function doesn't account for the size of the bmap.

See also
sg_cursor_inc_x()
void sg_cursor_draw_cursor ( sg_cursor_t *  dest_cursor,
const sg_cursor_t *  src_cursor,
sg_size_t  width 
)

Draws a horizontal line on dest_cursor by copying the values of the src_cursor and updates the x location of the dest_cursor to the pixel past the end of the operation.

Parameters
dest_cursorThe cursor where pixels will be drawn
src_cursorThe cursor where pixels are copied from
widthThe number of pixels to copy

This function operates on 32-bit words. It is much faster than a sg_get_pixel()/sg_draw_pixel() loop.

void sg_cursor_draw_hline ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor,
sg_size_t  width 
)

Draws a horizontal line at the cursor's location and increments the cursor's position to the pixel after the end of the line.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor
widthThe width of the line

The cursor will use the containing sg_bmap_t's pen for color and thickness.

This function operates on the bmap using 32-bit words so it is faster than simply drawing pixels using a loop.

void sg_cursor_draw_pattern ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor,
sg_size_t  width,
sg_bmap_data_t  pattern 
)

Draws the specified pattern in a horizontal line at cursor.

Parameters
cursorThe cursor
widthThe number of pixels to draw
patternThe pattern to draw

This function operates on 32-bit words and is much faster than a sg_draw_pixel() loop.

void sg_cursor_draw_pixel ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor)

Draws a pixel at the cursor's location and increments the location of the pixel.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor
sg_color_t sg_cursor_get_pixel ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor)

Returns the value of the pixel at the cursor's location and increments the location of the pixel.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor
Returns
The value of the pixel at the cursor's location (before incrementing)
void sg_cursor_inc_x ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor)

Increments the cursor's x value by one.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor

This function does not account for the width of bitmap object. If you need to increment through multiple rows try this approach.

1 sg_cursor_t y_cursor;
2 sg_cursor_t x_cursor;
3 sg_size_t i,j;
4 sg_cursor_set(&y_cursor, bmap, p);
5 
6 for(i=0; i < 10; i++){
7  sg_cursor_copy(&x_cursor, &y_cursor);
8  for(j=0; j < 10; j++){
9 
10  sg_cursor_inc_x(&x_cursor);
11  }
12  sg_cursor_inc_y(&y_cursor);
13 }
void sg_cursor_inc_y ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor)

Increments a cursor's y location.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor

This function doesn't account for the size of the bmap.

See also
sg_cursor_inc_x()
void sg_cursor_invert_hline ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor,
sg_size_t  width 
)

Inverts a horizontal line at the cursor's location and increments the cursor's position to the pixel after the end of the line.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor
widthThe width of the line

This function operates on the bmap using 32-bit words so it is faster than simply drawing pixels using a loop.

The operation is a bitwise invert (~ C operator). Using 1bpp, the result is obvious. Using more than 1bpp, how the invert looks will depend on how the display palette is set up to render the bitmap.

void sg_cursor_set ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor,
const sg_bmap_t *  bmap,
sg_point_t  p 
)

Sets the value of the cursor to point to p in bmap.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor
bmapA pointer to the source bitmap object
pThe point in the bmap where the cursor will point
void sg_cursor_shift_left ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor,
sg_size_t  shift_width,
sg_size_t  shift_distance 
)

Shifts the pixels at cursor to the left.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor
shift_widthThe number of pixels to shift
shift_distanceThe distance to shift shift_width pixels
void sg_cursor_shift_right ( sg_cursor_t *  cursor,
sg_size_t  shift_width,
sg_size_t  shift_distance 
)

Shifts the pixels at cursor to the right.

Parameters
cursorA pointer to the cursor
shift_widthThe number of pixels to shift
shift_distanceThe distance to shift shift_width pixels
